snippet: Grim data about distracted driving has prompted New York State to assign highway troopers to a special fleet to catch cellphone texters.
abstract: Editorial praises success of New York State's anti-texting squad, group of highway troopers who have assigned thousands of tickets in just two months to drivers who text at the wheel; cites statistics showing that distracted driving killed more than 3,000 people in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Grim data about distracted driving has prompted New York State to assign highway troopers to a special fleet to catch cellphone texters.
